info.title: Sardis API
info.description: Payment OS for AI Agents - Secure stablecoin execution with policy enforcement, MPC wallets, and compliance.

post.description: Create and store a new payment mandate (does not execute).

get.description: List mandates scoped to the caller's organization.

schema.title: Response List Mandates Api V2 Mandates Get

get.description: Get mandate details (org-scoped).

post.description: Validate a mandate without executing it.
Execute a previously created mandate.
Cancel a pending mandate.
Execute a payment mandate directly (legacy endpoint).

Execute an AP2 payment with full compliance checks.

Flow:
1. Verify mandate chain (signature, expiry, amount validation)
2. Check rate limits
3. Perform KYC verification for high-value transactions
4. Screen addresses for sanctions
5. Execute payment
6. Log compliance decisions
Issue a TAP identity with domain binding. In-memory for MVP.
Validate AP2 payment mandate: signature, domain binding, replay, TTL, policy.

Validate + execute a single-rail Base Sepolia USDC payment.
Requires SARDIS_CHAIN_MODE=live and SARDIS_EOA_PRIVATE_KEY configured.

get.description: Lightweight counters + safety limits for MVP.

List ledger entries.

This is the canonical endpoint used by SDKs.

schema.title: Response List Entries Api V2 Ledger Entries Get

get.description: Get a ledger entry by transaction ID.

Verify a ledger entry's audit anchor.

Current behavior: returns valid=true if the entry exists and has an audit_anchor.

schema.title: Response Verify Entry Api V2 Ledger Entries  Tx Id  Verify Get

get.description: Get recent ledger transactions.

schema.title: Response Get Recent Transactions Api V2 Ledger Recent Get

get.description: Get ledger statistics.

post.description: Create a new hold (pre-authorization) on funds.

get.description: List all active holds.

schema.title: Response List Active Holds Api V2 Holds Get

get.description: Get a hold by ID.

post.description: Capture (complete) a hold.
Void (cancel) a hold, releasing the funds.

get.description: List holds for a wallet.

schema.title: Response List Wallet Holds Api V2 Holds Wallet  Wallet Id  Get

post.description: Mark expired holds as expired. Admin endpoint.

schema.title: Response Expire Old Holds Api V2 Holds Expire Post

post.description:
Create a new approval request.

This endpoint creates an approval request when an agent action requires
human review (e.g., payment exceeds policy limits, card creation).

**Example use cases:**
- Payment exceeds per-transaction limit
- Monthly spending limit about to be exceeded
- Creating a virtual card with high limit
- Suspicious transaction flagged by compliance

get.description:
List approvals with optional filters.

This endpoint supports filtering and pagination to help manage
approval workflows efficiently.

**Common use cases:**
- Get all pending approvals: `?status=pending`
- Get high-urgency approvals: `?urgency=high&status=pending`
- Get approvals for specific agent: `?agent_id=agent_123`

Get an approval by ID.

Returns detailed information about a specific approval request.

post.description:
Approve a pending approval request.

This endpoint allows a human reviewer to approve an action that was
previously blocked by policy limits or compliance rules.

When approving a payment action, the held payment is automatically
resumed and executed if the mandate chain snapshot is available.

**Important:** Only pending approvals can be approved.

Deny a pending approval request.

This endpoint allows a human reviewer to deny an action that was
requesting approval.

**Important:** Only pending approvals can be denied. A denial reason
is recommended for audit purposes.

Cancel a pending approval request.

This endpoint allows cancelling an approval request (e.g., if the agent
no longer needs to perform the action).

**Important:** Only pending approvals can be cancelled.

get.description:
List pending approvals.

Convenience endpoint to get only pending approvals, optionally filtered by urgency.

post.description:
Expire all pending approvals that have passed their expiration time.

This endpoint should be called by a background job periodically to
clean up stale approval requests.

**Returns:** Count of expired approvals.

schema.title: Response Expire Pending Approvals Api V2 Approvals Expire Post

get.description: List all available webhook event types.
List all webhook subscriptions.

schema.title: Response List Webhooks Api V2 Webhooks Get

post.description: Create a new webhook subscription.

get.description: Get a webhook subscription by ID.

post.description: Send a test event to verify the webhook endpoint.

get.description: List delivery attempts for a webhook subscription.

schema.title: Response List Deliveries Api V2 Webhooks  Subscription Id  Deliveries Get

post.description: Rotate the webhook signing secret.

get.description: List all supported blockchain networks.

post.description: Estimate gas for a stablecoin transfer.

get.description: Get the status of a transaction.
List supported tokens for a chain.

post.description:
Execute multiple transfers in a batch.

This endpoint allows sending multiple transfers atomically or sequentially.
Each transfer is validated and executed independently. If one fails, others
may still succeed (fail-safe behavior).

Use this for:
- Payroll distributions
- Bulk payments to multiple recipients
- Multi-recipient airdrops

get.description: List all service categories.

post.description: Create a new service listing.

get.description: List active services.

schema.title: Response List Services Api V2 Marketplace Services Get

get.description: Get a service by ID.

post.description: Search for services.

schema.title: Response Search Services Api V2 Marketplace Services Search Post

post.description: Create a service offer.

get.description: List offers for an agent.

schema.title: Response List Offers Api V2 Marketplace Offers Get

get.description: Get an offer by ID.

post.description: Accept an offer (provider action).
Reject an offer (provider action).
Mark an offer as completed.
Create a review for a completed offer.

get.description: List reviews for a service.

schema.title: Response List Reviews Api V2 Marketplace Services  Service Id  Reviews Get

post.description:
Login with username and password.

Returns a JWT access token on successful authentication.

Refresh the access token.

Requires a valid (non-expired) token.

get.description: Get current user information.

post.description:
Logout endpoint.

Revokes the current JWT (by JTI) for the remainder of its lifetime.

Create the first admin API key using a dashboard JWT.

This is meant for demo/dev bootstrapping, so that an operator can mint an
API key without already having one.

Login with username and password.

Returns a JWT access token on successful authentication.

Refresh the access token.

Requires a valid (non-expired) token.

get.description: Get current user information.

post.description:
Logout endpoint.

Revokes the current JWT (by JTI) for the remainder of its lifetime.

Create the first admin API key using a dashboard JWT.

This is meant for demo/dev bootstrapping, so that an operator can mint an
API key without already having one.
Create a new non-custodial wallet for an agent.

get.description: List all wallets.

schema.title: Response List Wallets Api V2 Wallets Get

get.description: Get wallet details.

post.description: Set spending limits for a wallet.

get.description: Get wallet balance from chain (non-custodial, read-only).
Get all wallet addresses (chain -> address mapping).

schema.title: Response Get Wallet Addresses Api V2 Wallets  Wallet Id  Addresses Get

post.description: Set wallet address for a chain.

get.description: Get wallet for a specific agent.

post.description: Transfer crypto from wallet to any address (including A2A transfers).

Freeze a wallet to block all transactions.

Use this for compliance holds, suspicious activity, or risk mitigation.
Frozen wallets cannot send transactions until unfrozen.

Unfreeze a wallet to restore normal operations.

This removes the freeze hold and allows transactions to proceed.

Execute a direct agent-to-agent payment.

Transfers tokens from sender agent's wallet to recipient agent's wallet.
Both agents must exist, have active wallets, and have addresses on the
specified chain. Policy checks are enforced on the sender's wallet.

Handle inbound A2A messages (payment requests, credential verifications, etc.).

Processes structured A2A messages according to the A2A protocol.
Currently supports: payment_request, credential_request, ack.

get.description:
Return the Sardis agent card for A2A discovery.

Other agents can use this to discover Sardis capabilities,
supported tokens/chains, and API endpoints.

post.description: Generate an Onramper widget URL with wallet address pre-filled.

get.description: Proxy to Onramper quotes API.

post.description: Get a USDC to USD off-ramp quote.
Execute USDC to USD off-ramp (send USDC to Bridge, receive USD).

get.description: Check off-ramp transaction status.

post.description: Handle Onramper transaction completion webhook.
Create a new AI agent.

get.description: List all agents.

schema.title: Response List Agents Api V2 Agents Get

get.description: Get agent details.

post.description:
Create a signed payment identity used by MCP bootstrap.

This endpoint provides the "one-click" artifact a developer can pass to:
  npx @sardis/mcp-server init --payment-identity <id>

get.description: Resolve a signed payment identity for MCP initialization.

post.description: Bind an existing wallet to an agent.
Send a natural language instruction to an agent for policy-checked execution.

get.description: Get current spending limits and usage for an agent.

schema.title: Response Get Agent Limits Api V2 Agents  Agent Id  Limits Get

get.description:
List all API keys for the organization.

Note: The actual key secrets are never returned.

post.description:
Create a new API key.

**Important:** The `key` field in the response is only shown once.
Store it securely - it cannot be retrieved later.

Requires: Valid API key with 'admin' or 'api_keys:create' scope.

get.description: Get details of a specific API key.

delete.description:
Revoke (deactivate) an API key.

This action cannot be undone. The key will immediately stop working.

get.description: Get information about the currently used API key.

post.description:
Create a checkout session for agent payment.

This endpoint:
1. Validates wallet and policy
2. Routes to appropriate PSP (Stripe, PayPal, etc.)
3. Returns checkout session with redirect URL

get.description: Get checkout session status.

post.description:
Handle webhooks from PSPs (Stripe, PayPal, etc.).

This endpoint processes payment status updates from PSPs.

Parse a natural language policy into structured format.

This endpoint uses AI to convert human-readable spending policies
into structured rules that can be enforced by the payment system.

**Examples:**
- "Allow max $500 per day on AWS and OpenAI, block gambling"
- "Spend up to $100 per transaction, require approval over $500"
- "Only allow cloud services with $1000 monthly limit"

**Returns:** Structured policy with spending limits, restrictions, and rules.

Preview a policy from natural language before applying.

This is a safety feature that shows what the AI understood from your
natural language input, allowing you to confirm before applying.

**Human-in-the-loop protection:**
- Prevents misinterpretation (e.g., "$500" parsed as "$5000")
- Shows blocked categories clearly
- Highlights any unusual restrictions

Parse natural language and apply policy to an agent.

**IMPORTANT:** Set `confirm: true` to actually apply the policy.
Otherwise, use `/preview` first to see what will be applied.

**Safety features:**
- Requires explicit confirmation
- Returns the applied policy for verification
- Logs all policy changes for audit

schema.title: Response Apply Policy From Nl Api V2 Policies Apply Post

get.description:
Get example natural language policies.

These examples demonstrate the supported policy syntax and can be
used as templates for creating your own policies.

schema.title: Response Get Policy Examples Api V2 Policies Examples Get
Response Get Active Policy Api V2 Policies  Agent Id  Get

post.description:
Evaluate a hypothetical purchase against the agent's active policy.

For demo purposes, currency is treated as 1:1 with the policy's default currency.

Create a new KYC verification inquiry for an agent.

This initiates the KYC flow. The returned session_token and redirect_url
can be used to embed the verification in your frontend.

get.description:
Get the KYC verification status for an agent.

Returns the current verification status, including any warnings
about upcoming expiration.

Check if KYC is required for a transaction.

Returns whether the agent needs to complete KYC verification
before proceeding with the transaction.

post.description:
Screen a wallet address for sanctions.

Checks the address against OFAC, EU, UN, and other sanctions lists.

Screen a transaction for sanctions compliance.

Checks both the sender and recipient addresses.

get.description:
Quick check if an address is blocked.

Faster than full screening for simple allow/block decisions.

post.description:
Add an address to the internal blocklist.

This is for manual blocking based on internal risk assessment.

get.description:
Get overall compliance system status.

Shows which providers are configured and their status.

Check if Persona webhook verification is properly configured.

Returns the configuration status without exposing the secret.

post.description:
Handle Persona KYC webhook events.

SECURITY: This endpoint verifies the HMAC signature before processing.
Unsigned or invalid webhooks are rejected with 401.

Supported events:
- inquiry.completed: KYC verification completed
- inquiry.expired: KYC verification expired
- inquiry.failed: KYC verification failed
- inquiry.approved: KYC verification approved
- inquiry.declined: KYC verification declined

Persona Webhook Docs: https://docs.withpersona.com/docs/webhooks
Create a new invoice.

get.description: List invoices for the authenticated organization.

schema.title: Response List Invoices Api V2 Invoices Get

get.description: Get invoice details.

Get admin dashboard statistics.

Rate limited to 10 requests per minute.

List all admin users.

Rate limited to 10 requests per minute.

schema.title: Response List Admin Users Api V2 Admin Users Get

post.description:
Update system configuration.

SENSITIVE: Rate limited to 5 requests per minute.

delete.description:
Clear system caches.

SENSITIVE: Rate limited to 5 requests per minute.

get.description:
Get current rate limit status for the requesting client.

Useful for monitoring and debugging rate limit issues.

post.description:
Create an audit log entry.

All admin actions should be logged for compliance.

Send testnet tokens from the Sardis faucet EOA to a wallet address.

Requirements:
- SARDIS_EOA_PRIVATE_KEY must be set (funded testnet EOA)
- Only testnet chains are supported
- Max 100 USDC per request
- Not available in production

get.description: Check faucet availability and EOA balance.
A2A agent card for discovery (standard .well-known path).
Root endpoint with service information.
Kubernetes liveness probe.
Kubernetes readiness probe.
Deep health check endpoint with component status.
Lightweight API v2 health check.
